original_title: Brahms and the Little Singing Girls
overview: This is Palmer's highly controversial portrait of Brahms - a film that exploded  the familiar image of 'stodgy old bearded Brahms' - a man whose first musical  experience had been playing an upright piano in the brothels of Hamburg where he  had grown up, and who at the end of his life lived a bachelor in Vienna having his  every need satisfied by the prostitutes of the city whom he always affectionately  described as his â€˜little singing girls'.  It is a celebration - of Brahms' unabashed, life-enhancing, sexually explosive music.  Warren Mitchell portrays the composer
title: Brahms and the Little Singing Girls
